title: Altaglake
body:
History

The Age of Beginnings

The city’s temple was made by Fenraye Hudda, and is the first of the black temples, although this historical fact has been forgotten.

Geography

The city is set between the base of the Golian Ridge and the edge of a great lake. The shelter of the Golian Ridge and the humidity from the lake creates a microclimate, and as such the city is often cool and humid in the morning and evening, and is often clouded in mist during the Blessed Seasons. The warm winds from the Lenitar Sands remove much of the humidity during the day. This has meant that most of the city’s inhabitants wake during the early and late hours, and sleep during the day.


The surroundings lands of the city are inhabitable. The further away from the city’s lake, the less fertile the ground becomes. To the North and West of the Golian ridge lie barren wastelands of dead vines and gnarled dead forests, which seldom recover during the Blessed Seasons, and to the East lie the Lenitar Sands. On occasion, for reasons unknown, the barren surrounding landscapes bloom during the Autumn. This is said to be a bad omen, despite the colourful display of leaves and flowers it brings.
preface: Altaglake is an old city, with most of its houses being made from a dark black stone called Uronite. However, it must be noted that this stone is not the same as that with which the Temples are made, which is sourced from the Hollow Mountain.
